definition: to be interdependent
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
to depend on/to comply with or listen to sb/according to/in the light of
mutually dependent for life (idiom); to rely upon one another for survival/interdependent
lit. as close as lips and teeth (idiom); closely related/interdependent
interdependent

sentences.english: Forrest Gump and his mother had each other.
sentences.chinese: 阿甘和他的母亲相依为命。

sentences.english: We are fair, honest, true, and practical , and depend on customers' supporting with growing together.
sentences.chinese: 公平诚信，求真务实，与客户相扶相依，共同成长。

sentences.english: So nice to know there are jackalopes around.
sentences.chinese: 人生在世，起伏不定，很高兴跳跳羊和我们相依。
相依性属性回呼和验证。

sentences.english: Jack is a young boy. He lives with his mother.
sentences.chinese: 杰克是一个年轻小伙子，他与妈妈相依为命。

sentences.english: The mother and daughter shared their life together, supporting each other through years of hardship.
sentences.chinese: 母女俩相依为命度过了苦难的岁月。

sentences.english: Any man's death diminishes me because I am involved in mankind.
sentences.chinese: 任何人的死都令我萎缩，因为我和全人类唇齿相依。

sentences.english: Side by side with you till the end.
sentences.chinese: 和你相偎相依到光的尽头。

sentences.english: In such an interdependent world, what happens in Europe and the US will have an impact in Asia, probably sooner rather than later.
sentences.chinese: 在这唇齿相依的世界，欧美的现状早晚会影响亚洲。

sentences.english: Attaches a binding to this element for the specified dependency property.
sentences.chinese: 针对指定的相依性属性，附加此项目的系结。

sentences.english: We belong perpetually to each other-for life or for death.
sentences.chinese: 我们永远相依为命，同生死。

sentences.english: They had lived on each other all these years.
sentences.chinese: 这些年来他们一直相依为命。

sentences.english: Programs that require the ability to send or receive control characters have an environmental dependency.
sentences.chinese: 需要收发控制字元的程式是环境相依的。

sentences.english: We companied each other with tears and laughter.
sentences.chinese: 我们无论泪水还是欢笑都相偎相依。

sentences.english: So the most distant way in the world is not in the being seperated branches.
sentences.chinese: 而是同根生长的树枝却无法在风中相依。

definition: to accompany sb/to accompany each other
to moisten with spittle (idiom); sharing meager resources/mutual help in humble circumstances
to nestle against/to snuggle up to
to stay together/to rely on one another
from dawn to dusk/all the time
lit. body and shadow follow each other (idiom)/fig. inseparable
to look at one another/to face each other
enduring while the world lasts (idiom, from Laozi); eternal/for ever and ever (of friendship, hate etc)/also written 天長地久|天长地久
(literary) to be a good match
to rely on/to depend on/to imitate (a model)/to base a work (on some model)
two hearts beat as one (idiom); a kindred spirit
to be kind and love one another (idiom); bound by deep emotions
lit. as close as lips and teeth (idiom); closely related/interdependent
to keep watch/on guard
whispering in a low voice (idiom); murmuring
lit. heads rubbing together (idiom)/fig. very close relationship
